item.title: Text to md5 convertor
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I decided to throw together a simple text to md5 converter.

Heres the code:

[code]/*

  • Md5.java
  • @version 1
  • @author Wintergreen ratwacker@hotmail.com
    */

import java.security.*;

public class Md5 {
public String preMd5 = “”;
public String md5 = “”;
public void convert(String pre) {
preMd5 = pre;
System.out.println(“Warning! Md5 hashes cannot be reverced!”);
byte[] defaultBytes = preMd5.getBytes();

    try {
        MessageDigest algorithm = MessageDigest.getInstance("MD5");

        algorithm.reset();
        algorithm.update(defaultBytes);
        byte messageDigest[] = algorithm.digest();
        
        StringBuffer hexString = new StringBuffer();

        for (int i = 0; i < messageDigest.length; i++) {
            hexString.append(Integer.toHexString(0xFF & messageDigest[i]));
        }
        String foo = messageDigest.toString();

        System.out.println("Converting " + preMd5 + " to MD5");
        System.out.println("MD5 is " + hexString.toString());
        md5 = hexString + "";
    } catch (NoSuchAlgorithmException nsae) {}
}

}[/code]

To use:

Md5.convert("TEXT YOU WANT CONVERTED");

If you get an error about not being able to call a non-static method in a static method thing do this:

Md5 md5 = new Md5(); md5.convert("TEXT YOU WANT CONVERTED");

Read full topic
